programme.title: Top Rank Boxing
programme.desc: Emanuel Navarrete (39-2-1, 32 KOs) defends his WBO World super featherweight title for the fourth time since beating Liam Wilson for it on Feb. 3, 2023; Charly Suarez (18-0-0, 10 KOs) comes off a TKO win over Jorge Castaneda on Sept. 20.

programme.title: UFC 315: Muhammad vs Della Maddalena
programme.desc: Belal Muhammad (24-3) defends his welterweight title against Jack Della Maddalena (17-2) in the main event; Valentina Shevchenko (24-4-1) defends her flyweight title against Manon Fiorot (12-1-0); Jose Aldo (32-9) vs. Aiemann Zahabi (12-2).

programme.title: MLB Baseball
programme.desc: Cleveland won two of three games at Philadelphia last season, winning the rubber game of the series, 4-3; Philadelphia outscored the Guardians in the three-game series last year, 12-7, thanks to an 8-0 victory in the middle game.

programme.title: 2025 NBA Playoffs
programme.desc: Minnesota evened the series at one game apiece with a 117-93 win over Golden State in Game 2 behind 24 points and 11 assists from Julius Randle, along with 20 points from Anthony Edwards; Jonathan Kuminga led the Warriors with 18 points.

programme.title: ESPN FC
programme.desc: Analysts recap the recent El Clasico match between Real Madrid and FC Barcelona, breaking down highlights of the key moments throughout the contest, the significant stats that determined the outcome, and interviews with the players and managers.

programme.title: Baseball Tonight: Sunday Night Countdown
programme.desc: A preview of the upcoming Major League Baseball game with expert analysis, insightful observations and exclusive interviews; coverage includes highlights of Major League Baseball games and the latest baseball news with knowledgeable commentary.

programme.title: UFL Football
programme.desc: St. Louis (4-2) won two-straight games after a 12-6 victory over Memphis behind a Max Duggan TD pass to Hakeem Butler; Memphis (1-5) comes off a 21-20 loss to Houston after picking up its first win of the season over Birmingham, 24-20.

programme.title: NWSL Soccer
programme.desc: Kansas City claimed wins against Bay FC in both of their meetings from the 2024 season, winning the final matchup on Oct. 12 with a 1-0 scoreline; Temwa Chawinga scored while teammate Kayla Sharples had 6 clearances and 3 interceptions in the win.

programme.title: 2025 NBA Playoffs
programme.desc: Boston swept all four regular-season meetings with New York, including a 119-117 overtime win in the last matchup on April 8 behind 34 points from Kristaps Porzingis and 32 from Jayson Tatum; Karl-Anthony Towns led the Knicks with 34 points.

programme.title: NBA Draft Lottery
programme.desc: The 14 teams that missed the playoffs learn their spot in the 2023 NBA Draft; Detroit, Houston and San Antonio hold the highest percentage for the top pick and a shot at top prospects including Victor Wembanyama, Scoot Henderson and Brandon Miller.

programme.title: The Pat McAfee Show
programme.desc: Former NFL punter Pat McAfee and his friends deliver one-of-a-kind opinions on the latest news making headlines in sports and entertainment, along with special segments and guest interviews with some of the biggest names to give a unique experience.

programme.title: NBA Today
programme.desc: Malika Andrews covers the latest news from around the NBA, breaking down the stories making headlines across the league, highlights and takeaways from recent games, and guest interviews to get a unique perspective on the league.

programme.title: NBA Countdown
programme.desc: Expert analysts preview the upcoming action in the NBA, evaluating the strengths and weaknesses of each team while breaking down the pivotal matchups; coverage includes exclusive interviews, insightful commentary and special features.

programme.title: 2025 NBA Playoffs
programme.desc: Denver gained a 2-1 series lead with a 113-104 overtime win over Oklahoma City in Game 3 behind 27 points from Jamal Murray, along with 20 points and 16 rebounds from Nikola Jokic; Jalen Williams led the Thunder with 32 points in the loss.

programme.title: NFL2Night
programme.desc: The latest news and reports around the NFL are discussed in detail with a panel of expert analysts weighing in on the hottest issues, while veteran football reporters provide up-to-date information from team headquarters across the league.

programme.title: NBA Courtside
programme.desc: Players get prepared for the upcoming game through their warm-up routines, as cameras go around the arena to see the fans get excited with tipoff nearing and capture the pregame energy before the starting five lineups are announced.

programme.desc: Mike Greenberg, who joined ESPN in 1996 as an anchor, joins former NBA star Jalen Rose for roundtable discussions about the latest sports news making headlines as well as analysis of recent big games and interviews with expert commentators.

programme.desc: Tony Kornheiser and Michael Wilbon, longtime colleagues and friends, engage in verbal sparring during a fast-paced and wide-ranging discussion about current events in the world of sports; Kornheiser and Wilbon also interview special guests.

programme.desc: A panel of reporters from across the country debate trending topics and stories in sports with points being awarded for valid arguments, and at the end of the show, the winner is awarded 30 uninterrupted seconds to discuss any topic of their choice.

programme.title: 2025 NBA Playoffs
programme.desc: New York jumped out to a 2-0 lead in the series with a 91-90 win over Boston in Game 2 behind 21 points and 17 rebounds from Karl-Anthony Towns, along with 23 points from Josh Hart; Derrick White and Jaylen Brown led the Celtics with 20 points.

programme.title: Banana Ball
programme.desc: Savannah Bananas take the field against the Party Animals; Bananas play a fast-pace and entertaining brand of baseball, which includes players wearing kilts, choreographed dances and epic scoring celebrations.

programme.title: NCAA Softball Selection Show
programme.desc: The 64-team field for the NCAA Regionals is set, along with the 16 host teams and top eight national seeds that would host a Super Regional if they advanced; analysts break down which teams have the toughest road to the Women's College World Series.

programme.title: College Lacrosse
programme.desc: Two-time defending champion Notre Dame is making its 18th appearance in the last 19 possible years behind Chris Kavanagh; No. 4 seed Ohio State won its first Big Ten Tournament title, and beat the Fighting Irish, 10-9, on March 8.

programme.title: SEC Inside
programme.desc: SEC teams prepare for their upcoming opponent with practice sessions and work inside the film room, featuring coaches drilling their players and offering advice, an exclusive look at how the schools game plan, and exclusive talks with team members.

programme.title: Major League Rugby
programme.desc: Houston (7-0-4) has won four of the five previous meetings with the Legion, including a 34-14 victory in Week 7, as David Coetzer scored a try and finished with a game-high 12 points; San Diego (7-0-5) comes off a 45-36 win over NOLA Gold on May 4.

programme.title: College Baseball
programme.desc: No. 11-ranked Vanderbilt, which leads the nation with 12.2 strikeouts per nine innings, reached double-digit strikeouts in 13 of its last 14 games coming into the series with the Vols; Andrew Fischer leads No. 15-ranked Tennessee in home runs.

programme.title: SEC Inside
programme.desc: SEC teams prepare for their upcoming opponent with practice sessions and work inside the film room, featuring coaches drilling their players and offering advice, an exclusive look at how the schools game plan, and exclusive talks with team members.

programme.title: Hey Rookie, Welcome to the NFL
programme.desc: Malik Nabers, Terrion Arnold, Laiatu Latu and Chop Robinson give an all-access look as they get ready for the 2024 NFL Draft, showing the training they go through, the gym workouts and their Combine, along with their time away from the sport.

programme.title: E:60
programme.desc: Basketball royalty has always been in the Hurley family, from the dad, Bob Sr., in high school coaching to Bobby at Duke, but now Dan Hurley has settled into his spot amongst college coaching greats after leading UConn to back-to-back titles.

programme.title: Full Court Press
programme.desc: Iowa guard Caitlin Clark, UCLA guard Kiki Rice and South Carolina center Kamilla Cardoso go through the record-breaking 2023-24 season, as Clark looks to become the all-time leading scorer in collegiate basketball history over Pete Maravich.

programme.title: Numbers on the Board
programme.desc: Four friends talk all things NBA basketball and provide their unique perspectives, breaking down results from the recent games, the latest news making headlines across the league and rumors making the rounds that could create waves.

programme.title: Hey Rookie, Welcome to the NFL
programme.desc: Cameras follow the newest members of the NFL as they go through the draft, preseason, training camp, numerous hazing rituals instigated by veteran players, and an assortment of other situations that will test each rookie's mettle.

programme.title: Hey Rookie, Welcome to the NFL
programme.desc: Cameras follow the newest members of the NFL as they go through the draft, preseason, training camp, numerous hazing rituals instigated by veteran players, and an assortment of other situations that will test each rookie's mettle.

programme.title: NASCAR Cup Series
programme.desc: Defending Cup Series champion Joey Logano secured his first win of the season with his victory at Texas over Ross Chastain; Kyle Larson and Chastain won the two races at Kansas last year over Chris Buescher and current points leader William Byron.

programme.title: MLB Baseball
programme.desc: New York split its four-game series at home against Chicago last season, including a 7-6 win in 11 innings in the series finale on May 2, 2024, behind a walk-off, two-RBI double from Francisco Lindor for his third and fourth RBIs of the game.

programme.title: PBA Bowling
programme.desc: The most talented bowlers in the world compete for lucrative prize money and coveted trophies, challenged by various lane oil patterns throughout the season, requiring bowlers to adjust ball angle, rotation and speed in order to succeed.

programme.title: Bassmaster Elite Series
programme.desc: Trey McKinney of Carbondale, Ill. won last year's edition after finishing with a total weight of 130 lbs., 15 ounces, just ahead of Tyler Rivet (125 lbs., 9 oz.) of Raceland, La. to earn $101,000 in total winnings for his first-place finish.

programme.title: Indycar NICS Racing
programme.desc: Two-time defending champion Alex Palou increased his lead over Christian Lundgaard to 60 points after winning at Barber for his third win in the first four races; Palou averaged 118 mph en route to his win last year over Will Power.

programme.title: NASCAR RaceDay
programme.desc: RaceDay previews the AdventHealth 400 and defending Cup Series champion Joey Logano, who comes off his first win of the season at Texas, going over the latest news from pit road and updated track conditions, along with their predictions.

programme.title: Indycar INXT Racing
programme.desc: Rookie Dennis Hauger increased his lead over fellow rookie Lochie Hughes to 32 points after a win at Barber to make it two-straight victories to open the season; Jacob Abel and Louis Foster won the two races at Indianapolis last year.

programme.title: MLB Baseball
programme.desc: Logan Webb (4-2, 2.61) allowed an earned run or fewer in three of his last four starts, holding Colorado to one run in seven innings on May 4; Chris Paddack (0-3, 5.57) went five innings in each of his last five starts with a 2.88 ERA in that span.

programme.title: MotoGP
programme.desc: Alex Marquez moved into first place and gained a one-point lead over his six-time MotoGP champion brother, Marc, after winning at Spain for his first MotoGP win of his career; Jorge Martin won the sprint race last year over Marc Marquez.

programme.title: UFL Football
programme.desc: Michigan (4-2) rebounded from its loss to St. Louis with a 38-14 win over DC behind three total touchdowns from Bryce Perkins; Arlington (3-3) dropped its last two games since beating St. Louis, 30-15, on April 19 behind Luis Perez.

programme.title: NASCAR Craftsman Truck Series
programme.desc: Corey Heim secured his third win of the season and 14th Truck Series win of his career after his victory at Texas over Daniel Hemric; Heim won both races at Kansas last year, averaging 132.722 mph to win the 2024 Heart of America 200.

programme.title: Indycar NICS Racing
programme.desc: Two-time defending champion Alex Palou increased his lead over Christian Lundgaard to 60 points after winning at Barber for his third win in the first four races; Palou averaged 118 mph en route to his win last year over Will Power.

programme.title: UFL Football
programme.desc: Michigan (4-2) rebounded from its loss to St. Louis with a 38-14 win over DC behind three total touchdowns from Bryce Perkins; Arlington (3-3) dropped its last two games since beating St. Louis, 30-15, on April 19 behind Luis Perez.

programme.title: PBA Bowling
programme.desc: The most talented bowlers in the world compete for lucrative prize money and coveted trophies, challenged by various lane oil patterns throughout the season, requiring bowlers to adjust ball angle, rotation and speed in order to succeed.

programme.title: MotoGP
programme.desc: Alex Marquez moved into first place and gained a one-point lead over his six-time MotoGP champion brother, Marc, after winning at Spain for his first MotoGP win of his career; Jorge Martin won the sprint race last year over Marc Marquez.

programme.desc: Defending Cup Series champion Joey Logano secured his first win of the season with his victory at Texas over Ross Chastain; Kyle Larson and Chastain won the two races at Kansas last year over Chris Buescher and current points leader William Byron.

programme.title: The Herd with Colin Cowherd
programme.desc: Breaking down the biggest sports news of the day along with various unique segments that help the host present his opinions on sports; players, coaches and celebrities are interviewed and discuss trending topics happening around the world.

programme.title: Speak
programme.desc: The daily sports talk show delivers a compelling, incisive and passionate filter to the top sports stories of the day as the host engages in lively discussions, debates and disagreements over the day's news, and no topic is off limits.

programme.title: First Things First
programme.desc: Media personalities offer their views and opinions on the day's most intriguing storylines across the world of sports, including debates on the latest issues, analysis of player performances, and discussions on game results and other news.

programme.title: The Facility
programme.desc: Former football players break down the latest sports news making headlines across the country, giving a unique perspective from the athletes point of view on results of some of the recent marquee matchups and the stories impacting their league.

programme.desc: Craig Carton, a newly inducted member of the New York State Broadcasters Hall of Fame, joins Chicago sports radio personality Danny Parkins and FOX NFL game analyst Mark Schlereth to discuss the most enticing stories in sports each weekday morning.

programme.title: NHRA in 30
programme.desc: Thorough coverage of the latest NHRA events is showcased, including detailed play-by-play, replays of the most exciting and pivotal moments from the race as well as exclusive interviews, special features, insightful commentary and highlights.

programme.title: America's Day at the Races
programme.desc: Nationwide coverage of thoroughbred racing from venues around the country, showcasing major stakes races with in-depth analysis from expert handicappers; coverage includes the latest horse racing news, exclusive interviews and insightful commentary.

programme.title: The Rover of Tobruk
programme.desc: The life of Bob Quinn was much more than becoming a legend and captain for the Port Adelaide Football Club, serving his country of Australia during World War II and receiving the Military Medal for his actions during the Siege of Tobruk.

programme.desc: Competitive lumberjacks oppose each other in various disciplines based on traditional logging skills in an effort to determine the best all-around lumberjack; Hot Saw, Single Buck, Springboard Chop, Standing Block Chop, Stock Saw and Underhand Chop.

programme.desc: Trey McKinney of Carbondale, Ill. won last year's edition after finishing with a total weight of 130 lbs., 15 ounces, just ahead of Tyler Rivet (125 lbs., 9 oz.) of Raceland, La. to earn $101,000 in total winnings for his first-place finish.

programme.desc: Al-Hilal beat Al-Orobah in their first meeting of the season on Jan. 11, 5-0, behind a brace from Marcos Leonardo and a goal plus assist from Renan Lodi; R√∫ben Neves and Ali Albulayhi also ound the net for Al-Hilal in the shutout win away from home.
